documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
there is nobody in the world who must try to prevent you, in order to see to
it that he is given something he has a right to be given.
Some people are rather stricter about the right to life. In their view, it does
not include the right to be given anything, but amounts to, and only to, the
right not to be killed by anybody. But here a related difficulty arises. If every-
body is to refrain from killing that violinist, then everybody must refrain
from doing a great many different sorts of thing
